title: Denjoy–Koksma inequality
summary: In mathematics, the Denjoy–Koksma inequality, introduced by Herman (1979, p.73) as a combination of work of  Arnaud Denjoy and the Koksma–Hlawka inequality of Jurjen Ferdinand Koksma, is a bound for Weyl sums ∑ k = 0 m − 1 f ( x + k ω ) {\displaystyle \sum _{k=0}^{m-1}f(x+k\omega )} of functions f of bounded variation.
